taskDescription:
Percent Error. When performing a scientific experiment that results in quantities of some sort, such as mass in chemistry or momentum in physics, the percent error is often computed. Percent error, % E E, is the percent by which the value obtained in an experiment, the observed value O O, is different than the value that was expected, the expected value E E, in the experiment. The formula is below.
% E = | O − E | E \% E = \frac{{|O - E|}}{E}
Jim and Kelly are working on a chemistry experiment and expect the result to be 50 grams. However, their result was 48.7 grams. Find Jim and Kelly’s percent error.
